titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Michael C. Jacobsen collection of Coney Island memorabilia 2008.005
titlestmt.author: John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:40:39 +0000.

did.unittitle: Michael C. Jacobsen collection of Coney Island memorabilia

physdesc.extent: in two record cartons and one manuscript box

did.abstract: Collection consists of Coney Island related memorabilia and ephemera that was collected by Michael C. Jacobsen, with items dating from circa 1880 to 1998. Among the amusement parks, rides, and businesses represented in the collection are Cook's Baths, the Cyclone, Elephantine Colossus, Luna Park, Nathan's Famous, the Parachute Jump, Steeplechase Park and Pool, and the Wonder Wheel. The collection contains assorted commemorative memorabilia, postcards, photographs, viewbooks, motion pictures, and other Coney Island related ephemera.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: For comprehensive listings of our Coney Island holdings, please see the BHS Library and Archives' Coney Island and Gravesend subject guide.
The Brooklyn ephemera collection (ARC.202) includes two series which pertain to Coney Island, Series 5: Entertainment and Series 8: Sports.
Addtionally, BHS holds numerous artifacts relating to Coney Island. These items can be searched in our in-house artifact database in the Othmer Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: A detailed inventory of the items found in this collection is located in the collection's accession file.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Michael C. Jacobsen collection of Coney Island memorabilia, 2008.005, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Items published or sold prior to 1923 are in the public domain. The copyright status of all other items in the collection has not been determined. Please consult library staff for more details.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of Coney Island related memorabilia and ephemera that was collected by Michael C. Jacobsen, with items dating from circa 1880 to 1998. Among the amusement parks, rides, and businesses represented in the collection are Cook's Baths, the Cyclone, Elephantine Colossus, Luna Park, Nathan's Famous, the Parachute Jump, Steeplechase Park and Pool, and the Wonder Wheel.

Memorabilia found in the collection include four ashtrays, one bottle opener, one pack of Brooklyn gum, three ceramic plates, three charms, one cigarette lighter, several coins, a Nathan's Famous button, two matchbooks, four paperweights, one pennant, one pin, salt and pepper shakers, seven silver spoons, two thermometers, one wooden box, and a View-master with three reels. Additionally, the collection includes fourteen glasses, mugs, and cups.
The collection contains a large number of tickets, tokens, badges, coupon books, and trade cards for amusements and bath houses.

The collection has an audiovisual component, and includes two VHS tapes and one Super 8mm film reel. One VHS tape is entitled "Coney Island: a documentary film" (1991). The film reel contains a 23 minute short film, entitled "Coney Island," originally produced in 1917 and starring Fatty Arbuckle and Buster Keaton. The second VHS tape is a copy of this film.
Other items found in the collection include sheet music, brochures, postcards, photographs, viewbooks, magazines, and programs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to users without restriction. The motion pictures included in the collection are currently inaccessible due to their format. Please consult library staff for more information.
